quote: Where are the quotes?
author: Yousef Yousef

quote: Literature is humanity talking to itself.
author: Norman Rush

quote: I get asked to read new works a lot, in the hope that I will give a quotation and I will only give a 'puff' for a book I truly love.
author: Peter James

quote: Keep reminding yourself that literature is one of the saddest roads that leads to everything.
author: André Breton

quote: Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: Literature is my Utopia
author: Helen Keller

quote: Circumstances are the seeds of literature.
author: Salvador de Madariaga,  Essays with a Purpose

quote: Inspirational quotes are dances of light that shine in dark places during your life.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Always be wary of people who use quotes. I don't know who said that.' - Murdoc Niccals
author: Gorillaz,  Gorillaz: Rise of the Ogre

quote: Literature is the safe and traditional vehicle through which we learn about the world and pass on values from on generation to the next. Books save lives.
author: Laurie Anderson

quote: The best writing speaks when the heart whispers.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: Sir,’ said Stephen, ‘I read novels with the utmost pertinacity. I look upon them--I look upon good novels--as a very valuable part of literature, conveying more exact and finely-distinguished knowledge of the human heart and mind than almost any other, with greater breadth and depth and fewer constraints.
author: Patrick O'Brian,  The Nutmeg of Consolation

quote: The struggle of literature is in fact a struggle to escape from the confines of language; it stretches out from the utmost limits of what can be said; what stirs literature is the call and attraction of what is not in the dictionary.
author: Italo Calvino

quote: What is wonderful about great literature is that it transforms the man who reads it towards the condition of the man who wrote.
author: E.M. Forster,  Two Cheers for Democracy

quote: Literature can remind us that not all life is already written down: there are still so many stories to be told.
author: Colum McCann,  Let the Great World Spin

quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.
author: Fernando Pessoa,  The Book of Disquiet

quote: A great writer reveals the truth even when he or she does not wish to.
author: Tom Bissell

quote: Literature adds to reality, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides; and in this respect, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Literature adds to reality, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides; and in this respect, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: The best book is not one that informs merely, but one that stirs the reader up to inform himself.
author: A.W. Tozer,  Man The Dwelling Place Of God

quote: Quotation confesses inferiority.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Uncollected Writings

quote: I have a self-made quote: Celebrate diversity, practice acceptance and may we all choose peaceful options to conflict.
author: Donzella Michele Malone

quote: Poets are shameless with their experiences: they exploit them.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Puns are the highest form of literature.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: If my work has a theme, I suspect it is a simple one: that most human beings are inescapably alone, and therein lies their tragedy.
author: Richard Yates

quote: These are all novels, all about people that never existed, the people that read them it makes them unhappy with their own lives. Makes them want to live in other ways they can never really be.
author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451

quote: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Poets utter great and wise things which they do not themselves understand.
author: Plato

quote: Literature is news that stays news.
author: Ezra Pound,  ABC of Reading

quote: I'm not an inspirational quote kind of person.
author: Christine Teigen

quote: Good books tell the truth, even when they're about things that never have been and never will be. They're truthful in a different way.
author: Stanisław Lem

quote: Every quote is like a Picasso. The meaning is different for each person and half the admirers miss the true intent and twisted humor of it all.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: The author explains that some find recourse from injustice in literature and art but that these tend to deepen sensitivity to injustice rather than dull it.
author: John Howard Griffin,  Black Like Me

quote: Tis the good reader that makes the good book; in every book he finds passages which seem confidences or asides hidden from all else and unmistakenly meant for his ear; the profit of books is according to the sensibility of the reader; the profoundest thought or passion sleeps as in a mine, until it is discovered by an equal mind and heart.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: ‎"With each experience we grow and become more aware of the inner beauty that lies within us. Ultimately we are truly our own leader. We lead the connection and flow of life that is our inheritance.
author: Rabbi Yossi

quote: People that love quotes are those short on time, but long on big ideas.
author: Bruce Edwin

quote: It is not a single cowardice that drives us into fiction's fantasies. We often fear that literature is a game we can't afford to play — the product of idleness and immoral ease. In the grip of that feeling it isn't life we pursue, but the point and purpose of life — its facility, its use.
author: William H. Gass,  Fiction and the Figures of Life

quote: The true poem rests between the words.
author: Vanna Bonta,  Shades Of The World

quote: The author must keep his mouth shut when his work starts to speak.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Literature is the art of discovering something extraordinary about ordinary people, and saying with ordinary words something extraordinary.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: Literature is strewn with the wreckage of those who have minded beyond reason the opinion of others.
author: Virginia Woolf,  A Room of One's Own

quote: Writing a novel is one of those modern rites of passage, I think, that lead us from an innocent world of contentment, drunkenness, and good humor, to a state of chronic edginess and the perpetual scanning of bank statements.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: It is my ambition to say in ten sentences what others say in a whole book.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Sometimes I wonder if there's something wrong with me. Perhaps I've spent too long in the company of my literary romantic heroes, and consequently my ideals and expectations are far too high.
author: E.L. James,  Fifty Shades of Grey

quote: Fools have a habit of believing that everything written by a famous author is admirable. For my part I read only to please myself and like only what suits my taste.
author: Voltaire,  Candide

quote: It is time to browse through the precious books that have meant the most to you that you may rediscover illuminating phrases and sentences to light your pathway to the future...
author: Wilferd Peterson

quote: Old books that we have known but not possessed cross our path and invite themselves over. New books try to seduce us daily with tempting titles and tantalizing covers.
author: Alberto Manguel,  The Library at Night

quote: A book comes and says, 'Write me.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: One merit of poetry few persons will deny: it says more and in fewer words than prose.
author: Voltaire,  Philosophical Dictionary
